meanings.definition: The state of being soaked with liquid.
meanings.sent1: After playing in the rain, the soddenness of my clothes made them heavy.
meanings.sent2: The soddenness of the sponge made it difficult to absorb any more water.
meanings.sent3: The soddenness of the towel made it a terrible choice for drying off.
meanings.sent4: The soddenness of the ground turned the field into a muddy mess.
meanings.sent5: The soddenness of the fabric was so extreme that it dripped water when squeezed.

meanings.definition: The quality of being thoroughly wet or saturated.
meanings.sent1: The soddenness of the cloth was evident by how it sagged heavily.
meanings.sent2: The soddenness of the soil made it impossible to plant anything.
meanings.sent3: The soddenness of the paper caused it to tear easily.
meanings.sent4: The soddenness of the air after the storm made breathing feel heavy.
meanings.sent5: The soddenness of the towel made it useless for drying dishes.

meanings.definition: The condition of being heavy or dull.
meanings.sent1: The soddenness of the atmosphere made everyone feel lethargic.
meanings.sent2: The soddenness of the music drained all energy from the room.
meanings.sent3: The soddenness of the conversation left everyone feeling bored.
meanings.sent4: The soddenness of the mood in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The soddenness of the book's plot made it hard to stay interested.
